conclusion: The bullet of mass m leaves the toy-gun barrel with an unknown horizontal speed v₀.
The bullet penetrates the hole in the ping-pong ball of mass M.
The bullet and ball stick together and move as one body of mass (M+m) with a common horizontal speed v.
The impact is perfectly inelastic and occurs quickly, so external forces like gravity do not change the horizontal momentum.
Using conservation of horizontal momentum: m v₀ = (M + m) v.
Right after the impact, the combined body leaves the table edge horizontally with speed v, at a vertical drop h above the floor.
Horizontal motion equation: v = s / t = s √(g / 2h).
Combine results: m v₀ = (M + m) s √(g / 2h).
Solve for bullet's exit speed: v₀ = (M + m) s √(g / 2h) / m.
Final expression for bullet exit velocity: v₀ = (M + m) s √(g / (2 h)) / m.
M = mass of the clay-filled ping-pong ball, m = mass of the bullet, h = height of the table, s = horizontal range measured on the floor, g ≈ 9.81 m/s² (acceleration due to gravity).
Assumptions: perfectly inelastic impact, negligible air resistance, level gun barrel, table edge and ball center at the same height h above the floor.
